title: Stacey Solomon says Rex's birth brought up trauma for Joe Swash
text:
Rex’s birth was bittersweet for the couple (Picture: Rex/Stacey Solomon)

Stacey Solomon has opened up about Joe Swash’s sadness that their baby, Rex, will never get to meet his late father.

Joe lost his father when he was just 11 years old, and Stacey admitted Joe wishes his child could have met his grandad.

She explained on Loose Women: ‘It is a trauma and I am always surprised that people are surprised that you grieve forever.

‘Joe lost his dad when he was 11 and it has had a fundamental impact on his life, especially when huge life events happen – even if they are positive.

‘When we had Rex, it was trauma. At the same time as being the most wonderful thing in the world.’

She added: ‘He never got to show his dad his son, and he’ll never get that chance and he thought about that a lot.

‘It really impacted, and I think still impacts, his life.’

Joe sadly lost his own father when he was a child (Picture: BACKGRID)

Stacey explained that losing his dad unexpectedly at such a young age shaped Joe into who he is: ‘A lot of decisions he makes and a lot of who he is is shaped by the circumstances, for good and for bad.

‘There are positives and negatives that have come out of it – even if you don’t feel like there’s anything positive.

‘Joe is extremely resilient, he stepped into a role of almost being the dad of the family so he gained skills he would never have gained outside of those circumstances.

‘It’s made him an incredible person… But at the same time, it’s taken away a piece of his life that he will never get back.’

Joe also has a 12-year-old son, Harry, from a previous relationship while Stacey has sons Zachary, 11, and Leighton, 7, from two previous partners.

The couple have been dating since 2016 after meeting in Australia while filming I’m A Celebrity… Get Me Out Of Here, and welcomed their son this year.
